a person who has given himself or herself to the worshipping of linga (Śiva).
= ಲಿಂಗರೋಗ.
= ಲಿಂಗತನು.
= ಲಿಂಗದೇಹಿ.
the man who has the complete and true knowledge of linga.
(vīr.) a particular stage in the devotional or philosophical progress.
= ಲಿಂಗಸ್ಥಲ.
(vīr.) a realisation of the the principles of the Linga.
(vīr.) a vow being loyal to the linga that has been given by one's spiritual teacher and not worshipping any other linga.
the male germ cell, found in semen, which penetrates the ovum or egg, of the female to fertilise it; spermatozoon.
being or becoming one with Śivalinga.
he who has become one with Śivalinga.
a training given to a person by a spiritual teacher regarding worshipping of, and the secret of, linga.
a person who is so initiated into the Vīraśaiva sect.
the sect itself.

offered, given, submitted to linga.
the act of offering, giving or submitting (something) to linga.
Śiva, the form of a linga.
a true devotee, who is considered as Śiva.
a Vīraśaiva nun.
= ಲಿಂಗಧರ.
a monk; a religious ascetic.

a Vīraśaiva nun.
